Monster Creation list???
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Japanese DS Games Archive: Monster Farm DS: Misc. Q&A (post all new topics here, we'll make more sections later): Monster Creation list???
By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, July 11, 2007 - 08:58 am:

Usually one of the first sections we try to put up is the CD/Passwords list for a game, listing all monsters. What do I call this list, since sounds can be used as well as drawings? Is the above title ok?

By GM on Wednesday, July 11, 2007 - 12:12 pm:

How about a slightly different approach for this one?

One thing we can do is have seperate sections for the three
different methods of regeneration. We can also be a bit more
practical and consolidate everything in a "Regeneration List",
which would largely be the same but would be significantly
neater. The only problem would be having to make different
sections for every monster breed, but that's a capacity issue.
What can we get away with?

If we were to have a single Regeneration List directory without
the three subdirectories, it'd save lots of bandwidth, but end up
utterly confusing. However, this can be remedied by taking all
the submissions and organizing them according to their type.
It's a small bit of elbow grease, and I personally consider it to be
the best option.

The thing we have to worry about, though, is how to present
these things. The GBA carts are obvious, but what of sounds and
images? Images are too much for the board, after all. We also
have to present the sounds in such a way as to ensure people
don't mispronounce them and end up with the wrong monster
time and time again. That could cause a great deal of
frustration. Furthermore, what of odd onomotopaeic noises?
Ideally, an audio file would work, but once again, too much for
the site.

I propose a plea of assistance to Mr. Fenrick to host audio and
image files.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, July 11, 2007 - 12:33 pm:

We can have unlimited sub-categories. Sort of like how, in the existing CD lists, one clicks Pixie and sees all the sub-breeds' names. We can keep going deeper like that.

So, with the old CD lists as a reference, we could put two or three (or however-many) sub-categories of regeneration types under each breed. So, for example, when clicking Pixie/Worm a user would see Passwords, GBA Carts, Sketches, Sounds.

BTW, I'll be in chat tonight from 8:30pm Pacific til about 10pm Pacific.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, July 11, 2007 - 12:45 pm:

test area is up, what do people think?

The main breeds page will be in alphabetical order.
The subs will be listed by book order (with the book # in parenthsis).
The creation options will be in the same order under every sub-breed.

General warning to all new users: Do not expect the list to be complete immeditely! We post subs as we find them! There will be a MiscQ&A thread for posting new types as they are found, whiners will be suspended from the site!

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, August 22, 2007 - 09:42 am:

By 13thm00n on Sunday, August 26, 2007 - 12:58 pm:

Im sorry if I sound extremely like a noob, but what is a modoki? I mean I know its not a monster but....

By GM on Sunday, August 26, 2007 - 01:19 pm:

A mokoki monster in MFDS is basically a false monster, or pseudo monster, of a certain breed. They're all ? subspecies, and have completely blue, silhouette-like bodies. There's one for every breed, like Suezo-Modoki (Suezo/?), Dragon-Modoki (Dragon/?) and Zan-Modoki (Zan/?).

Their stats are a bit lower than those of the pure breed, and their statgains are quite possibly lower as well (no one's actually confirmed the latter part).

Modoki monsters can only be regenerated via doodle regeneration, usually when you end up making a rather unimpressive portrait of a breed.

By 13thm00n on Monday, August 27, 2007 - 10:15 am:

okay thanks GM, then that means there was a Ripper-Modoki in MR4,

By GM on Monday, August 27, 2007 - 03:31 pm:

Nightsickle wasn't a Ripper-Modoki, actually, though it looks quite
similar to one. Its stats were quite different overall than the normal
Ripper as opposed to simply lower than it, and its book entry
doesn't make fun of it, which is the opposite case for the modoki
monsters.

By Sensei Le Roof on Tuesday, August 28, 2007 - 08:15 am:

Just for reference, "modoki" translates to "pseudo-".

By GM on Tuesday, August 28, 2007 - 04:04 pm:

By GM on Friday, February 8, 2008 - 12:35 pm:

If it's any consolation, there's a special Abisu monster that looks like a Gali subtype called Cosmo-Abisu. Its body resembles a Gali's robes, and it has a Gali mask on top of its cane.
